title: Privacy Policy
description: In the following privacy policy we inform you about the most important aspects of data processing on our website. We collect and process personal data only on the basis of the legal provisions (DSGVO, TKG).

children.value: In the following privacy policy we inform you about the most important aspects of data processing on our website. We collect and process personal data only on the basis of the legal provisions (DSGVO, TKG).

As soon as you access or visit our website as a user, your IP address and the beginning and end of the session are recorded. This is technically required and therefore constitutes a legitimate interest as of Art. 6 para 1 lit f DSGVO.

If you contact us, either via our contact form on our website or by email, then the data you send us will be stored for six months for the purpose of processing your request or in case of further follow-up questions. There is, without your consent, no disclosure of your transmitted data.

Our website uses so-called cookies. These are small text files that are stored on your end device with the help of the browser. They do not cause any damage. Some cookies remain stored on your end device until you delete them. They enable us to recognize your browser on your next visit.

We use cookies to make our website user-friendly. In the case of cookies that are not functionally necessary, we request your consent in the cookie window (Art. 6 para 1 lit a DSGVO). Only if it is actively given, your personal data will then be processed for the purpose of user-friendliness of our website.

If you do not wish cookies to be set, you can set up your browser so that it informs you about the setting of cookies and only allows this in individual cases. When deactivating cookies, the functionality of our website may be limited.
Your rights as an affected party
As an affected party, you have a fundamental right with regard to your data stored by us for:
Revocation and objection to data processing
If you suspect that in the course of processing your data violations of data protection law have occurred, you have the opportunity to complain to us or the data protection authority.
